Since relatively early on in the life of Windows 10, links from Windows search and Cortana were directed to Edge, which is still happening today. entry.title: Instagram might soon let you add moderators to live videos
entry.summary: Early last month, Instagram announced two new features for Live creators ‚Äî Live Scheduling and Practice Mode. The features aim to help make life easier for creators on the platform by giving them the option to schedule live streams up to 90 days in advance and test their connection, lighting, etc., before starting a live The post Instagram might soon let you add moderators to live videos appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: HP Victus 16 review: Budget gaming prowess with a lack of personality
entry.summary: The Victus by HP laptop, if you ask me, breathes a new life into HP‚Äôs lineup of gaming laptops. Sure the Omen series of gaming notebooks are still widely available with the latest hardware, but they‚Äôve been all over the place lately. The Victus series now sits below the Omen notebooks in the HP hierarchy, The post HP Victus 16 review: Budget gaming prowess with a lack of personality appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.summary: Did you get a notification on your Google Pixel telling you to update to Android 12, even though you already had? You‚Äôre not alone. entry.title: Like it or not, iOS is a better OS than Android for the average user

entry.title: You can now connect USB devices in Windows Subsystem for Linux under Windows 11
entry.summary: Microsoft introduced Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) a while back, which brought support for running Linux apps straight from your Windows installation. Being such a complex compatibility layer, WSL had some limitations. The initial implementation didn‚Äôt even use a full-fledged Linux kernel, so several applications faced compatibility issues. Version 2 made a lot of improvements, The post You can now connect USB devices in Windows Subsystem for Linux under Windows 11 appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Spring Boot Startup Actuator Endpoint
entry.summary: Spring Boot Actuator can help us understand where time is spent during application start up. We look at how to install it and use it to diagnose delays in initializing our Spring Boot application.

entry.title: Apple is encouraging people to use Apple Card Family by offering $10
entry.summary: Apple first announced its Apple Card Family feature back in April. It allows iCloud family members to share expenses and build credit together. The co-owners will have equal benefits, The post Apple is encouraging people to use Apple Card Family by offering $10 appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: These are the Best Apple Watch Series 7 Screen Protectors in 2021
entry.summary: The Apple Watch Series 7 is arguably the company‚Äôs best smartwatch to date. It packs a host of improvements over the Series 6, including a larger screen and refined design. The smartwatch also has thinner bezels and comes with WR50 water-resistant rating. In addition, it is the first Apple Watch to come with IP6X dust The post These are the Best Apple Watch Series 7 Screen Protectors in 2021 appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: TestFlight finally lands on macOS Monterey for all users
entry.summary: Apple announced few months ago that its beta testing tool ‚Äî TestFlight ‚Äî is coming to macOS. It first released the app in beta for developers to test back in August, but the public can finally start using it now, too. Just like other Apple software, TestFlight is available to download from the Mac App The post TestFlight finally lands on macOS Monterey for all users appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: What is Miracast: Everything you need to know about the screen mirroring standard
entry.summary: Several wireless display standards have popped up over the years. While some, like Intel WiDi, didn‚Äôt get much love from the consumers, others like Miracast have managed to stick around, thanks to their relatively wider adaption. But have you wondered about what exactly is Miracast and what it can do? entry.title: Best Foldable Phones: The Top Folding Smartphones that you can buy in November 2021
entry.summary: The idea of a foldable smartphone has seen its fair share of supporters and detractors, with the latter group mostly bemoaning their high prices and supposed fragility. Samsung‚Äôs taken major steps in addressing those concerns with the Galaxy Z Fold 3 and Galaxy Z Flip 3, two foldables that are priced lower than previous generations The post Best Foldable Phones: The Top Folding Smartphones that you can buy in November 2021 appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Start11 is out, letting you make the Windows 10 Start Menu look like Windows 11
entry.summary: Nearly a month after launching the release candidate, Stardock is releasing Start11 1.0. Like its predecessors Start10 and Start8, the utility is designed to allow you to customize your Start Menu. Indeed, Start8 was originally designed to fix the mess that was Windows 8, letting you bring back the old Windows 7 Start Menu. And The post Start11 is out, letting you make the Windows 10 Start Menu look like Windows 11 appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Deserialize Snake Case to Camel Case With Jackson
entry.summary: By default, Jackson expects the field names in JSON to match the ones in our Java POJOs. As Java usually uses camel case field naming by convention, this makes it harder to deserialize snake case JSON. We look at some ways to configure our code so that we can load JSON with other field naming conventions.

entry.title: Android 12 custom GSIs bring the latest Android OS to any Project Treble-supported device
entry.summary: Android 12 is here, albeit the stable version is available only on Google‚Äôs Pixel lineup ‚Äî including the newly introduced Pixel 6 series ‚Äî for now. A handful of OEMs like Samsung and OnePlus are also offering public beta builds of their customized skins based on the stable Android 12 codebase, but the list of The post Android 12 custom GSIs bring the latest Android OS to any Project Treble-supported device appeared first on xda-developers.

While we‚Äôve seen this move happen with other apps before, this app is taking away features users had already paid for. So if you‚Äôve purchased the app and any in-app purchases (IAPs) to The post [Update: Decision reverted] Popular iOS app Notability paywalls features that users already paid for, prompting raised pitchforks appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Facebook is shutting down its Face Recognition System
entry.summary: In a rather surprising move, Facebook (now Meta) has announced that it‚Äôs shutting down its Face Recognition system. The company says it will stop collecting facial recognition data and delete templates it has used to identify users over the years. As part of the change, Facebook will no longer automatically recognize people‚Äôs faces in Memories, The post Facebook is shutting down its Face Recognition System appeared first on xda-developers.

Ê∏∏ÊàèÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÂæ™ÁéØÔºöÂπ≤ÂëòÁ≥ªÁªü‚ÜíÊàòÊñóÁ≥ªÁªü‚ÜíËµÑÊ∫ê‚ÜíÂπ≤ÂëòÁ≥ªÁªüÔºåËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¥üÂèçÈ¶àÂæ™ÁéØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊó†Â§ñÁïåÂπ≤Êâ∞ÔºåÁ≥ªÁªüÂêÑÈ°πÂèÇÊï∞‰ºöÁ®≥ÂÆöÂú®‰∏Ä‰∏™Ê∞¥Âπ≥‰∏ä„ÄÇ ÈÄöÂ∏∏Êù•ËØ¥ÔºåÊó†‰ªòË¥πÁöÑÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩìÈ™å‰ºöÂú®Êüê‰∏™Êó∂ÂÄôÁ®≥ÂÆöÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Ê∞¥Âπ≥Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØ‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂØπÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩìÈ™åÁöÑË¶ÅÊ±ÇÂè™‰ºöË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÈ´òÔºåËÄå‰ªòË¥π‰ºöÊèêÂçáÊ∏∏Êàè‰ΩìÈ™å„ÄÇ ËµÑÊ∫êÁ≥ªÁªü„ÄÅÂπ≤ÂëòÊãõÂãü„ÄÅÁé©ÂÆ∂ÁöÑÊ∞¥Âπ≥‰ºö‰ªãÂÖ•Âà∞Ê†∏ÂøÉÂæ™ÁéØ‰∏≠ÔºåÁªô‰∫àÂÖ∂ÊèêÂçáÁöÑÂä®Âäõ„ÄÇ The core cycle of the game: Operator system ‚Üí Combat system ‚Üí Resources ‚Üí Operator system. This is a negative feedback loop. If there is no external interference, the system parameters will level off at a certain level. Generally speaking, the unpaid gaming experience will stabilize to a certain level at some point, and people's requirements for the gaming experience will only become increasingly higher, and paying will enhance the gaming experience. However, the resource system, recruitment of operators, and the gaming level of players will intervene in the core cycle, allowing it to improve.‚Ä¶

entry.title: Microsoft releases Windows 10 builds 19043.1320, 19042.1320 ‚Äì here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new

Like last year‚Äôs Moto watch, the new smartwatch ‚Äî dubbed the Moto Watch 100 ‚Äî isn‚Äôt built by Motorola itself but by a Canadian company called CE Brands Inc. According to an investor press release obtained by 9to5Google, the Canadian company will soon be launching the The post New Motorola-branded smartwatch with a circular display spotted on FCC appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Samsung Android 12 Tracker: Here are all the official One UI 4.0 beta builds to download and install
entry.summary: It‚Äôs that time of year again when Google releases the new version of its mobile operating system! The stable version of Android 12 is finally here after a long few months of beta testing, and a range of smartphone makers have already announced that they plan to roll it out to their users. Being one The post Samsung Android 12 Tracker: Here are all the official One UI 4.0 beta builds to download and install appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: JioPhone Next to launch with Google and Jio‚Äôs collaborative effort ‚Äî Pragati OS
entry.summary: Indian telecom giant Reliance Jio unveiled an ultra-affordable Android phone, called JioPhone Next, at its 44th Annual General Meeting this June. Back then, the company gave us our first look at the device and announced that it would go on sale on September 10th. However, Reliance Jio delayed the launch at the last minute, citing The post JioPhone Next to launch with Google and Jio‚Äôs collaborative effort ‚Äî Pragati OS appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Using Test Containers With Spring Data Cassandra
entry.summary: We can test our Spring Data integration with Cassandra by using Testcontainers. This starts a temporary instance of Cassandra to use during our tests. We investigate how to do this and configure spring during the test.

entry.title: Samsung rolls out third One UI 4 beta to the Galaxy S21 series
entry.summary: Last month, Samsung kicked off the One UI 4 Beta program, allowing select Galaxy S21 owners to try out the new Android 12 software ahead of the stable release. Earlier this month, Samsung released the second beta, which improved performance and fixed bugs related to virtual RAM, Samsung Keyboard, and more. Now the South Korean The post Samsung rolls out third One UI 4 beta to the Galaxy S21 series appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: WhatsApp may soon ask users to verify their identity to make payments
entry.summary: WhatsApp may soon ask users to verify their identity to make payments on the platform. New strings spotted in the latest WhatsApp beta release suggest that the messenger will require users to upload verification documents to continue using payments on WhatsApp. Currently, when you set up WhatsApp Pay in India, the service only verifies the The post WhatsApp may soon ask users to verify their identity to make payments appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Get Community, Shopping, and Support with My HUAWEI App
entry.summary: If you own a HUAWEI phone, laptop, tablet, or service, the My HUAWEI app is the best way to stay in touch with the community. This app comes in the form of an update to the old Support app. The new update brings many new features that combine shopping, community, and support into one app. The post Get Community, Shopping, and Support with My HUAWEI App appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: How to open the full right-click menu by default on Windows 11

As part of the UI overhaul, Microsoft also shipped a modernized right-click The post How to open the full right-click menu by default on Windows 11 appeared first on xda-developers.

While some OEMs have already started rolling out early builds of the software to a handful of devices, others are still getting around to sharing the release timeline for their phones. Yesterday, Vivo shared the Funtouch OS beta release timeline for The post iQOO releases Android 12 beta rollout schedule for its devices appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: ASUS announces Android 12 Release Schedule for Zenfone 8, Zenfone 7 and ROG Phone Series
entry.summary: ASUS today detailed its plans to roll out the stable Android 12 update for its ROG and ZenFone flagships. The Taiwanese company will kick off the stable Android 12 rollout by the end of this year, starting with the ZenFone 8 series, with devices like the ROG Phone 5 and others joining the Android 12 The post ASUS announces Android 12 Release Schedule for Zenfone 8, Zenfone 7 and ROG Phone Series appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Windows 11 Update Tracker: Download and Install the latest Windows 11 update
entry.summary: The wait is finally over ‚Äî Windows 11 is here as Microsoft has officially kicked off the Insider Preview program for the next generation of Windows. The company is also rolling out several updates on top of the base Windows 11 build in preparation for an eventual rollout via the stable channel. This article will The post Windows 11 Update Tracker: Download and Install the latest Windows 11 update appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: The iPhone 13‚Äôs boxy design may be the latest trend that Android OEMs copy
entry.summary: You might have noticed an annoying trend in the tech world over the last few years. Whenever Apple adopts a new design or technology, many Android and PC OEMs follow suit. While there‚Äôs no denying the fact that Apple too picks up on things first pioneered by companies on the other side of the fence, The post The iPhone 13‚Äôs boxy design may be the latest trend that Android OEMs copy appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Twitter finally rolls out the ability to create a Space to everyone
entry.summary: Last year Twitter introduced Spaces, the company‚Äôs take on Clubhouse-style audio chat rooms. Initially limited to iOS, Twitter finally expanded Spaces to Android earlier this year. At the time, Android users could only join Spaces created by other creators. But that changed in March when Twitter started allowing some Android users to host their own The post Twitter finally rolls out the ability to create a Space to everyone appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Google will finally let you set up Android work profile on unmanaged devices
entry.summary: Android work profiles provide a convenient way to separate your work and personal life on your smartphone. When this feature is enabled, work and personal apps appear under two different tabs within the app drawer. Work apps feature a small briefcase badge to distinguish themselves from personal apps. Right now, however, the work profile feature The post Google will finally let you set up Android work profile on unmanaged devices appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: These are the best Windows tablets this holiday season
entry.summary: As we approach the holiday season, many of us are starting to think about what gifts to get for ourselves or loved ones this year. To help out, we‚Äôve already rounded up some of the best laptops you can buy this holiday, but what if you specifically want a tablet? Windows tablets aren‚Äôt all that The post These are the best Windows tablets this holiday season appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Huawei launches a pair of smartwatches with HarmonyOS 2.1 and up to 14 days of battery life
entry.summary: Alongside the Huawei Nova 9 yesterday, Huawei unveiled a pair of new smartwatches. The Huawei Watch GT 3 is a slightly modified version of the Huawei Watch 3 that was launched in China back in June. The new smartwatch comes in 46mm and 42mm sizes and runs the latest version of Huawei‚Äôs watch OS, Harmony The post Huawei launches a pair of smartwatches with HarmonyOS 2.1 and up to 14 days of battery life appeared first on xda-developers.

entry.title: Amazfit brings its new GTR 3, GTR 3 Pro, and GTS 3 to the Indian market
entry.summary: Chinese wearables manufacturer Amazfit launched its latest premium smartwatch lineup in the US and Europe earlier this month. Unlike previous years, the company launched three models this year ‚Äî the Amazfit GTR 3, GTR 3 Pro, and the GTS 3. The new models bring several improvements over the Amazfit GTS 2 and GTR 2 from The post Amazfit brings its new GTR 3, GTR 3 Pro, and GTS 3 to the Indian market appeared first on xda-developers.

def handler_excel(filename=r'C:/Users/xxx/Desktop/haha.xlsx'): ¬† ¬†# Ê†πÊçÆÊñá‰ª∂Ë∑ØÂæÑÂä†ËΩΩ‰∏Ä‰∏™excelË°®Ê†ºÔºåËøôÈáåÂåÖÂê´ÊâÄÊúâÁöÑsheet ¬† ¬†excel = load_workbook(filename) ¬† ¬†# Ê†πÊçÆsheetÂêçÁß∞Âä†ËΩΩÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑtable ¬† ¬†table = excel.get_sheet_by_name('Sheet1') ¬† ¬†imgnames = [] ¬† ¬†# ËØªÂèñÊâÄÊúâÂàó ¬† ¬†for column in table.columns: ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†for cell in column: ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†imgnames.append(cell.value+".png") # ÈÄâÊã©ÂõæÁâá ¬† ¬†pickImg(imgnames)
ÈÅçÂéÜÊñá‰ª∂Â§πËØªÂèñÊñá‰ª∂ÂêçÔºåÊâæÂà∞targetÂπ∂Êã∑Ë¥ù ‰ΩøÁî®os.listdir ÊñπÊ≥ïÈÅçÂéÜÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåËøôÈáåÊ≥®ÊÑèwindowsÁéØÂ¢É‰∏ãÊãøÂà∞ÁöÑunicodeÁºñÁ†ÅÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅGBKÈáçÊñ∞Ëß£Á†Å def pickImg(pickImageNames): ¬† ¬†# ÈÅçÂéÜÊâÄÊúâÂõæÁâáÈõÜÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂Âêç ¬† ¬†for image in os.listdir( ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†r"C:\Users\xxx\Desktop\work\img"): ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†# ‰ΩøÁî®gbkËß£Á†ÅÔºå‰∏çÁÑ∂‰∏≠Êñá‰π±Á†Å ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†u_file = image.decode('gbk') ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†print(u_file) ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†if u_file in pickImageNames: ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†oldname = r"C:\Users\xxx\Desktop\work\img/" + image ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†newname = r"C:\Users\xxx\Desktop\work\target/" + image ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†# Êñá‰ª∂Êã∑Ë¥ù ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†shutil.copyfile(oldname, newname)
